ISSUE.TITLE: `podman compose` does not find compose providers not in `PATH`
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description If you place the `docker-compose` binary into a directory that is not in your PATH, e.g. `$HOME/.docker/cli-plugins/`, which is, according to the [default configuration](https://github.com/containers/common/blob/2b866ebf4f938616fb748fd4f5a020b64f7ccd70/pkg/config/default.go#L96-L104), a supported location, `podman compose` only returns the error ``` Error: exec: "docker-compose": executable file not found in $PATH ``` ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. place the `docker-compose` binary into one of the [supported docker cli-plugins directories](https://github.com/containers/common/blob/2b866ebf4f938616fb748fd4f5a020b64f7ccd70/pkg/config/default.go#L96-L104) 2. run `podman compose` ### Describe the results you received podman prints the error message: ``` Error: exec: "docker-compose": executable file not found in $PATH ``` ### Describe the results you expected `podman compose` should find `docker-compose` as compose provider and run it. ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.33.0-dev cgroupControllers: -
